{{infobox character | people=[[Edain|Adan]] | name=Eilinel | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames=the White{{LB|4}}, "''Of Gorlim the Unhappy''", line 298 | titles= | position= | location= | affiliation= | language= | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death=c. {{FA|455}} | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse=[[Gorlim]] | children= | gender=Female | height= | hair=Greying{{LB|3}}, line 165 | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} {{Quote|Gorlim, Gorlim!
Thou canst not have forsaken me.
Then slain, alas! thou slain must be!
And I must linger cold, alone,
and loveless as a barren stone!|[[Phantoms|Phantom]] of Eilinel in ''[[The Lay of Leithian Recommenced]]'', lines 244-8}} '''Eilinel''' was the wife of [[Gorlim|Gorlim the Unhappy]]. ==History== Eilinel was a fair and gentle maiden, and was much loved by Gorlim. When her husband went to the [[Dagor Bragollach]], their house was "roofless"{{LB|4}}, "''Of Gorlim the Unhappy''", lines 206-7 and their "fields and homestead" were plundered. Eilinel was killed "by butchers"{{LB|4}}, "''Of Gorlim the Unhappy''", line 332 in some "burned woods".{{S|19}} Upon returning home, Gorlim could not find any trace of Eilinel. He kept returning to their house seeking for his lost wife, and [[Sauron]] tricked him by devising a [[phantoms|phantom]] of Eilinel to make him betray the location of [[Barahir]]. ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| ANG | | | | | |ANG=[[Angrim]]
